Grid

Settings

Columns

$column-selector: ".default"
The selector of your column rules. Is set to .column by default.
$column-spacing: 2*$base-line-height
The column-spacing sets the distance between adjacent column's content. By default, column spacing is set by applying padding, but can be overridden with margins. See: @mixin column-spacing. The default setting for $column-spacing is twice the project's preset line-height, but can be changed to any measure - but only in pixels.
$column-widths: 1/2, 1/4, 1/3, 2/3, 3/4
A list of fractions. The grid's default behavior will render rules based on these values. The default column-widths are 1/1, 1/2, 1/3, 2/3 and 3/4 as these values are all that are necessary to create more complex 3, 8, 9, 12 and/or 16 column layouts.
$column-width-default: 1/1
This sets the default width of a column. If no width-selector is applied, the column will be of this width. It set to 1/1 (full width) by default.
$column-breakpoint: false
This setting expects an array of breakpoints. Breakpoints are key/value pair(s) of valid media expressions. Set to false by default. When set, it will provide basic responsive behavior by:

  1. stacking columns (width: 100%) - unless of course the column is persistent,
  2. halving column-spacing,
  3. halving bleed-margins.
$column-float:
If you prefer floated columns over of inline-blocks, set to true.

Root

$root-selector: ".root"
You can embed your grid layout in a ‘root’ container. Your grid layout will not stretch beyond the maximum width of this container. The root container can be positioned left or center, for alternate positions you can provide your own behavior. The default selector for the root container is .root, but you can also apply a base selector like body.
$root-max-width: 72em
Sets the maximum width on your container. Your grid layout will not stretch beyond this width. Default setting is 72em which translates to 1152px at a font-size of 16px. Change it to anything in a unit of choice.
$root-position: center
Position your root container left or center of the viewport. Default setting is center.

Fall back for inline-block style columns

$negative-right-margin: false
By default, this setting is set to false. If you cannot control your markup, you can assign a negative right margin to close gaps between columns that will otherwise break your layout. This is a hack and only nescessary when your html (or at the very least your column markup) is not minimized. When set, a value of 0.175 seems to produce accurate results. Adjust the value to your typography, as it will depend on your type's em-width.

Other Settings

Required settings for a stand-alone implementation of the grid:

$base-line-height: 24px
$base-line-height should be set in px and is used to calculate the column spacing.
When using the grid stand-alone, $reset-box-model should be set to true, unless you plan to wrap your columns in a padded container for compatibility with Microsoft Explorer <8 and Opera <10.

Mixins

@mixin column-behavior
Mixin basic column properties. Takes two optional parameters: $apply-border-box (boolean) and $column-float (boolean).
@mixin column-width
Mixin a width. Widths are expressed as fractions (e.g. 1/2) and are converted to percentages by the mixin. If a $column-breakpoint is set, the columns will be stacked - unless it was defined as persistent. Takes two optional parameters: $fraction and $persistent (boolean).
@mixin column-spacing
Mixin column spacing. Uses padding by default, but can be overridden to use margins instead - helpful when assigning backgrounds or borders. If a $column-breakpoint is set, the value will be halved below the breakpoint. Takes two optional parameters: $fraction and $use-margin (boolean).
@mixin column
Shorthand mixin for column, combines above mixins. Takes four optional parameters: $fraction, $persistent (boolean), $column-padding (fraction), $column-margin (boolean).
@mixin root
Fixes content width and centers in viewport. Takes one, optional parameter: $root-max-width in a valid unit.
@mixin container-behavior
Use it to remove column spacing on column parents. Takes no parameters.
@mixin move
Helper mixin for soure ordering. Takes one parameter: $fraction.
@mixin push
Helper mixin for soure ordering, move elements to the right by the set fraction. Positioning will be reset below the breakpoint (if set) and if $persistent is false. Takes two parameters: $fraction and $persistent (boolean, optional).
@mixin pull
Helper mixin for soure ordering, move elements to the left by the set fraction. Positioning will be reset below the breakpoint (if set) and if $persistent is false. Takes two parameters: $fraction and $persistent (boolean, optional).
@mixin bleed
Mixin to reverse padding on a container. Is helpful with nested columns. If a $column-breakpoint is set, the margins will be halved below the breakpoint. Takes two optional parameters: $fraction and $persistent (boolean).

Functions

@function horizontal-rhythm($fraction: 1/2)
Calculates a value1) based on the $column-spacing. Takes one parameter: $fraction.

1)Rem is experimental.
@function fraction-to-percentage($fraction: 1/3)
Convert a fraction to a percentage. Takes one parameter: $fraction.
@function fraction-to-text($fraction)
Convert a fraction to a word. Use to build style rules based on column widths. Takes one parameter: $fraction.
